title: Walmart joins list of retailers that have removed Zantac from shelves
text: Walmart Inc. WMT, -0.70% said Wednesday that it has removed products containing ranitidine from its shelves, including the Zantac, Equate and Member's Mark brands. Customers who have bought these products can return them to a Walmart or Sam's Club location for a refund. Ranitidine products have been found to contain a low level of a substance, nitrosodimethylamine, that could potentially cause cancer. The Food and Drug Administration is currently investigating the risk. Zantac is a Sanofi ADR SNY, -2.48% brand. Other retailers that have removed ranitidine products include Rite Aid Corp. RAD, +0.00%, CVS Health Corp. CVS, -1.14% and Walgreens WBA, -1.10%. Walmart stock is up 26.5% for the year to date while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -1.28% has gained 17.3% for the period.
description: Walmart Inc. said Wednesday that it has removed products containing ranitidine from its shelves, including the Zantac, Equate and Member's Mark brands....
